casebody.data:
Herbert BROWNELL, Jr., Attorney General of the United States, as Successor to the Alien Property Custodian, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Frieda Elizabeth RAUBENHEIMER, as Trustee under the Will of Charles Christian Raubenheimer, Defendant-Appellant. No. 45, Docket 22996. United States Court of Appeals Second Circuit. Argued Nov. 4, 1954. Decided Nov. 22, 1954. J. Edward Lumbard, U. S. Atty., New York City, Dallas S. Townsend, Asst. Atty. Gen., Milton E. Lacina, Asst. U. S. Atty., Mahopac, N. Y., James D. Hill, George B. Searls and Irvin A. Seibel, Attorneys, Department of Justice, Washington, D. C., for appellee. Dobson, Moorhead & Dwyer, Brooklyn, N. Y., John F. Middlemiss, Brooklyn, C. James Dwyer, Brooklyn, N. Y., of counsel, for defendant-appellant.

Before CHASE, MEDINA and HINCKS, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Judgment affirmed on opinion below, D. C., 112 F.Supp. 154.
